      "name": "v_plan_claim_diagnosis",
      "description": "This table contains information on diagnosis codes submitted with claims. This information is used to identify risk and cost associated with patient conditions. Both line level diagnosis codes from professional claims and header level codes from institutional claims are stored here.\n",

        {
          "name": "claim_diagnosis_id",

              }
            }
          ]
        },
        {
          "name": "claim_header_id",
          "description": "QDW claim header ID of the claim on which this diagnosis was mentioned.\n"
        },
        {
          "name": "orig_claim_header_id",
          "description": "ID of the claim, as specified in the plan data source, on which this diagnosis was mentioned.\n"
        },
        {
          "name": "diagnosis_code",
          "description": "ICD10 or ICD9 diagnosis code for the condition that the provider specified on the claim as being associated with the service provided.  The value is derived from the value in diagnosis_code_unscrubbed. The format includes a period, if one is required.  The process for scrubbing values from diagnosis_code_unscrubbed into diagnosis_code inserts missing decimal points as needed.  If the unscrubbed value cannot be mapped, the value is set to 'NoD.x'.\n"
        },
        {
          "name": "diagnosis_code_unscrubbed",
          "description": "Diagnosis code for the condition that the provider specified on the claim as being associated with the service provided.  This value is scrubbed into the diagnosis_code column.\n"
        },
        {
          "name": "diagnosis_code_type",
          "description": "Code indicating the type of diagnosis code that is specified in the diagnosis_code column.  Values are 'ICD9' or 'ICD10'.  If value is blank or ICD9, the system will auto-detech if it is ICD9 or ICD10.\n"
        },
        {
          "name": "diagnosis_code_type_unscrubbed",
          "description": "Indicates the type of diagnosis code that is specified in the diagnosis_code_unscrubbed column, as specified in the plan data source. \n"
        },
        {
          "name": "poa_ind",
          "description": "Present on Admission Indicator. Indicates whether the condition described by diagnosis_code was present at the time of the inpatient admission.  This is relevant for inpatient claims only.  Values are 'Y' (condition was present on admission), 'N' (condition was not present on admission), 'U' (unknown if condition was present on admission), and 'W' (not applicable).  \n"
        },
        {
          "name": "line_no",
          "description": "Number of the claim line that contains the service with which this diagnosis is associated.  This is relevant for claims that associate diagnoses with specific claim lines - typically, professional claims do it this way. For claims where the diagnoses are associated at the claim header level only, this column will be null - typically, institutional claims do it this way.  However, for some professional claims, diagnoses may not be linked to specific claim lines, in which case this column will be null.  To join from this table to a specific row in plan_claim_line, use the combination of claim_header_id and line_no.\n"
        },
        {
          "name": "seq_no",
          "description": "Sequence number of diagnosis for the claim.  The relative priority of the code as specified on the UB04 or CMS-1500 claim. Rows with a value of 1 in this column are considered primary diagnoses for the visit.  When the plan data source supplies diagnoses in separate columns with numeric suffixes such as diag_code1, diag_code2, etc., the value for this column is assigned based on the numeric suffix.  \n"
        },
        {
          "name": "admitting_diag_ind",
          "description": "Indicates if this diagnosis represents the admitting diagnosis for the claim.  This is relevant only for inpatient claims.\n"
        },
        {
          "name": "discharge_diag_ind",
          "description": "Indicates if this diagnosis represents the discharge diagnosis for the claim.  Is generally null.  \n"
        },
        {
          "name": "emergency_diag_ind",
          "description": "Indicates if this diagnosis represents an emergency diagnosis.  Is generally null.\n"

          "name": "orig_claim_diagnosis_id",

This is created by the connector query or direct feed that loads the row from a given source, and is derived from plan data source column(s) to uniquely identify a row. For a given source, one original ID corresponds to one and only one QDW ID for this entity.  The same original ID value could be found on more than one row if the rows are derived from different sources.\n"

Values are Y (deleted) and N (not deleted).  If the value is 'Y' then the row should be excluded from all queries.\n"
